description: Draws fractional models for educational visualization.
example_usage:
# Example usage for draw_fractional_models
result = draw_fractional_models(data)

educational_standards.description: Partition circles into two, three, or four equal shares.
Recognize that equal shares of identical wholes need not have the same shape.
Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts.
Identify visual models that represent unit fractions (1/n).
Understand a fraction a/b as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.
Represent a fraction a/b with a fraction model.
Determine the fraction of a whole described in a word problem and select the visual model that correctly represents that fraction (denominators ≤ 12).
Understand that the endpoint of an interval representing a fraction a/b on a number line locates the number a/b on the number line.
Recognize and generate simple equivalent fractions, explaining why the fractions are equivalent.
Compare two unit fractions.
Use rulers to measure objects in inches.
Create equivalent fractions by multiplying the numerator and denominator by the same number.
Simplify fraction to lowest terms.
Find equivalent fractions using area models.
Decompose proper fractions into a sum of fractions in multiple ways.
Understand subtraction of fractions as separating parts referring to the same whole.
Justify decompositions of a fraction into a sum of fractions with the same denominator by using a visual fraction model.
Add and subtract fractions with like denominators in recipes.
Decompose fractions into unit fractions using models.
Complete multiplication sentences that multiply unit fractions by whole numbers without models.
Solve mathematical problems involving multiplying whole numbers and fractions with models and repeated addition.
Express a fraction with denominator 10 as an equivalent fraction with denominator 100.
Model tenths with decimals and mixed numbers.
Identify place value of digits in decimal numbers.
Solve word problems involving subtraction of fractions.
Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions.
Interpret a fraction as division of the numerator by the denominator (a/b = a ÷ b) and solve word problems involving division of whole numbers resulting in fractional answers.
Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm, resulting in fractions.
